result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael E. Walker in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Gumz states that he would like a little more time in speaking with the State and requests a trial date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Jury Trial
bond continued  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Document: Proposed Order - Arrest-Bench Warrant Filed by: District Attorney Reason: warrant was quashed - def appeared later

Defendant Michael E. Walker in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM10 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the matters were set for this morning and a warrant was authorized.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed based on appearance of the defendant.

Atty Gumz apologizes with the court as to why his client was not here as there was some confusion on dates.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM10 tracking:
Atty Gumz states that he is not sure why his client is not here today.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Motion hearing on September 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
posted under case #15 CF 4

Jury trial at 05-12-2016 08:30 am.
*Bond will also cover 15CF4 and will be filed in 15CF4.

Defendant Michael E. Walker by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz who appears in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also heard with 15CF4.
Atty Gumz makes statement to the Court.  Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond (which could be for both cases.)  Atty Gumz responds.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant previously issued is deemed satisfied.  Court sets $500 cash bond which will cover both cases (bond will be filed in 15CF4).  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Atty Hendee requests warrant.  Atty Gumz states he has not been able to reach his client.   BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

Defendant Michael E. Walker in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF4 & 15CM10:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint in both cases & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.  Atty Hendee does not object to a signature bond with conditions; this bond will cover both cases.  
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No access to the internet during the pendency of the case
*No unsupervised contact with any juvenile under the age of 10
*No contact with Ashley Kollaszar
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant regarding time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Set for Prelim on the 15CF4 case.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Set Return on 15CM10.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
